class.description: Contains certificates in a chain of authentication to a trusted root.

method.name: GetCert
method.descrip: Returns the Nth certificate in the chain.

method.name: IsRootTrusted
method.descrip: Returns _TRUE_ if the root of the certificate chain is a certificate found in ARG1.

method.name: VerifyCertSignatures
method.descrip: Verifies the certificate signatures to the root. Returns _TRUE_ if all certificate signatures are valid.

property.name: NumCerts
property.descrip: The number of certificates in the chain. The end-user subscriber certificate is at index 0. This is the certificate most removed from the trusted root. Intermediate certificates are at indices 1 to NumCerts - 2. The trusted root (or self-signed certificate) is at index NumCerts - 1.

property.name: NumExpiredCerts
property.descrip: Returns the number of certificates in the chain that have expired.

property.name: ReachesRoot
property.descrip: _TRUE_ if this certificate chain extends all the way to the root certificate. The root certificate is either a trusted CA root or a self-signed certificate. In both cases, the issuer of a root certificate is itself.
